newsitem.title: USA: Pool Energy buys stake in Malaysian venture.
newsitem.headline: Pool Energy buys stake in Malaysian venture.

text.p: Pool Energy Services Co said on Wednesday it has completed its previously announced acquisition of 51 percent interest in its Malaysia joint venture, Antah Drilling Sdn Bhd.
Pool Energy paid approximately $9 million in cash and assumed approximately $14.6 million in debt for the venture.
The selling party's name was not immediately available.

Previously accounted for as an unconsolidated affiliate, Antah Drilling is now a wholly owned subsidiary and its financial results will be reported on a consolidated basis in the company's financial statements, Pool Energy said.
Antah Drilling owns a state-of-the-art 2,000 horsepower platform drilling rig and a 1,000 horsepower platform workover rig, the company said.
These drilling and workover rigs are expected to generate a total of $17 million to $18 million per annum in revenues.
The drilling rig commenced operations in late August under a three-year initial term contract in the Bass Strait of Australia, and the workover rig is operating offshore Malaysia.
Antah Holdings Bhd was the firm that sold the stake to Pool Energy, a Pool Energy spokesman said.
